p: Synchrotron-based X-ray tomographic microscopy (XTM) has received widespread attention in the field of LIBs as it allows for non-invasive imaging of electrode microstructures with high spatial and temporal resolution. This technique has been used for ex-situ microstructure and morphological studies of pristine and cycled electrodes 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 10, as well as to track battery materials and electrodes during electrochemical cycling in-situ or in-operando 2 11 12 13 14 15.
